segments.text: I notice the puddle growing larger at the woman’s feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see it? It’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children seem so innocent in their little scheme, but I worry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel the tension in my stomach as I watch the boy stretch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's something charming about the way they work together, though.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden beyond the window looks serene; it’s such a stark contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how quickly a simple moment can turn chaotic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What will happen if he falls? It sends shivers down my spine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet here I am, just watching instead of intervening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could capture this moment without the impending doom.
segments.speaker: PAR
